website_summaries.verdict: A solid micro-shredder that rivals larger models for a fraction of the price – your best pick for value and performance.
pros: Packs a lot of convenient features in a small powerhouse model – 16-sheet shredding capability, 6-gallon bin, and a SafeSense function
cons: Not for continuous shredding – requires a cool-down period after 20 minutes of use

customer_reviews.title: NO SECURITY IN THIS SHREDDER
customer_reviews.text: I have never given a negative review to an item on Amazon, mostly because I research to the nth degree and know the quality of the product I am buying. However, after spending much time researching and previously having purchased the Fellowes 99MS from Amazon, I bought this item not recognizing it is a ridiculously outdated shredder. I was so focused on safesense technology for my daughter's baby that I lost sight of the piece of garbage the shredder is. If you just want to have fun cutting up paper, this works. If you want your shreds secure--DO NOT BUY THIS SHREDDER. With deep regrets over my clicking back and forth and not paying attention.
customer_reviews.author: Weanling

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 16 months..... very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Didn't last long at all. This was a very heavy high priced machine and I thought that it could last for few years but it didn't. All of the sudden yesterday it started running all by itself, no paper was in it and no one was near it. I tried to turn it off but it wouldn't turn off so I unplugged it. It smelled like burning plastic and won't restart. I checked the unit and there is no jam or paper in the teeth. I am just glad that I was home since it may have burned my house down if I weren't here to unplug it.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: One caster has already broken off. The bin is very cheap and hard to slide in and out. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Anston B

customer_reviews.title: Shreds paper but does not live up to the advertisment.
customer_reviews.text: Received the Fellowes Powershred 79Ci today. I had saved a box of paper ;that needed to be shredded but was very disappointed with the performance of the shredder. It was advertised to shred up to 16 sheets of paper at a time. When I shredded more than 5 sheets it would jam up and shut down. The container is supposed to hold up to 6 gallons of shredded paper but after about 1 1/2 gallons it has to be emptied, as it stops working/ I paid $179 for the shredder and I feel like I over paid for what it does. Very disappointed and I would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ingrid Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Big disappointment; this Fellows 79Ci Jam proof shredder JAMS and ...
customer_reviews.text: Big disappointment; this Fellows 79Ci Jam proof shredder JAMS and the bin will not stay attached preventing the shredder from running. Papers placed in slot and is accepted, will go 3/4 through, them jams,red light flashing, requiring back-and-forth forward then reverse until it goes through. One side on the bin does not latch properly requiring you the hold the bin in place to get the shredder to operate. I expected to get a easy to operate trouble free shredder for the cost. I would not buy a Fellows shredder.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: The long shreds cause the bin to fill up very quickly as there is so much "fluff" not at all like their true cross cut shredder which consolidates the shreds ...
customer_reviews.text: Filled with plastic parts, the head unit this replaced was all metal. Unfortunately the model this replaced, is no longer made. Stops feeding when fed a "junk mail" envelope which is just a bit thicker than "normal". Most importantly this sure doesn't appear to be a cross cut shredder as the pieces it makes are 1.5" long. The long shreds cause the bin to fill up very quickly as there is so much "fluff" not at all like their true cross cut shredder which consolidates the shreds tightly since the cross cut shreds are probably 1/4" square at the largest.
customer_reviews.author: rickhz

customer_reviews.title: trying to get a really good one that would last
customer_reviews.text: I paid a lot of money for this shredder, trying to get a really good one that would last. HAH! The plastic housing has cracked around where the wheels insert, so bad that one wheel has come completely off and now it is propped up with folded up cardboard. It shreds well, but so do cheaper models that I could have replaced more often! I am disappointed I purchased it. I followed a recommendation, too.
customer_reviews.author: Ol'Doc

customer_reviews.title: Poor design of shredder drawer
customer_reviews.text: This front left roller broke out in less than 1 year, rendering the product unusable. It was a fair shredder, but a poor design of the drawer, which caught on the bottom lip each time it was emptied. This contributed to the case breaking in less than a year.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen S.

customer_reviews.title: Good shredder, just not for the price
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't able to shred unopened mail that was no more than "12 pages" (more 3 pages but it was folded so we will call it 9 pages and then the envelope) and it jammed and activated the reverse function. When I pulled it out, it left partially cut pieces all over the floor. It does look very nice and fairly quiet. However, for this price and only a crosscut, it really needs to live up to everything stated. If this was around $80-100, I would keep it. But at about double that price point, I really can't accept the flaws.
customer_reviews.author: Mc

customer_reviews.title: Disaster!
customer_reviews.text: Disaster on wheels. 3/4 wheel housings were broken to back it went. Hines,try a real disappointment because the box is so heavy to get it to returns. Fellows this was a dismal fail and I've used your products for years.
customer_reviews.author: A's Reads

customer_reviews.title: love!
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific shredder. It's a great size---big but not too big. I've had it for a year, and it hasn't jammed once. It has an indicator to tell you if you put too much paper in, and even if you do it's easy to reverse the direction, so nothing gets stuck. The only complaint I have is that sometimes if you have a little slip of paper (like a single receipt), you have to fold it before you shred, or the shredder doesn't activate. That is pretty easy to deal with, though. I use mine at home, but it's versatile, and would be good for either home or office. No regrets! I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Always useful
customer_reviews.text: This model has never failed with its safety feature. It chews up disks into nice strands, same as paper. Paper slices are fairly small, about 5 inches. Easy to dispose and not hard to remove the trash like some other reviews might say (just use a bit of hand strength and some discretion on how full the can is). Low noise, but still makes shredding sounds. Quiet compared to office shredders I think. The size is rather nice: I can hide it under my desk without notice. Be sure to oil it regularly for long life, preferably after each emptying of the can at the longest (follow the suggested instructions for best results).
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: A piece of junk!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this shredder back in March 2019. I owned this same model for about 8 years and was thrilled with it. Not so thrilled with this new model. It stopped working a week ago and won’t even turn on. I moved it to 3 different outlets thinking that was the problem. I checked the shredder door as well as the inside to check for a jam. It is clear. The “on” button will not turn on or light up. My daughter and husband both looked at it. It is not working. Ugh. Save yourself time and money and buy another shredder.
customer_reviews.author: Savvy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: When it worked, it worked pretty well. It did jam a LOT, though, with only a couple of pieces of paper. It got stuck often, and the flimsy bin was horrible for putting back in and getting the shredder to turn on again. It broke just under a year of use using it ... and we used it maybe once or twice a month ... fairly light home use. We’re very ease on things and take good care of everything, too. So disappointed with this shredder, unfortunately. I had my previous Fellowes shredder for many years, and it was great.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Kaiser

customer_reviews.title: Best cross-cut shredder I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I accidentally put a knife blade down my old shredder and broke all the gears. This new shredder is miles ahead of other good-quality cross-cut shredders I've owned. This machine is very quiet, has a convenient dump drawer so you don't have to lift the heavy top off, wheels that work on thick carpet and a guide opening to show you where to put credit cards you want ground up. There is a touch-sensor that will stop the grinder should you get your sleeve cuff caught in the chompers. Fellowes has hit this one out of the park. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Zap

customer_reviews.title: jams constantly
customer_reviews.text: this shredder does not hold the paper capacity advertised, jams constantly and you have to empty tray when 75% full or it jams again. If I could get my money back I would return it. Be careful when you read the reviews.... the only reason I bought this was because it had good reviews. I work in a small office environment (10-12 ppl) and the shredder is not heavily used. It should not be jamming constantly like this. Does anyone know if I have a recourse with the manufacturer?
customer_reviews.author: NATELLA C.

customer_reviews.title: Power On Button Poorly Constructed
customer_reviews.text: The shredder operates well and shreds all materials listed by the manufacturer. The problem with it is a poorly designed power on button that after repeated use the plastic holding the switch breaks and allows the button to fall into the shredder's housing creating a safety issue. This has been a reported problem by other users over the recent past and Fellowes does not appear to want to correct. Contact with their Customer Service indicates you can buy another button for ca. $30.00, take the power head off and disconnect the electronics and install the replacement. I would not recommend this shredder to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: John E. Bartos

customer_reviews.title: We've run hundreds of pages with no problems.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the first one through Amazon as "Used - Like new". We sent it back since it was definitely not like new. We paid the extra $20 and bought a new one. We had a family member pass away and we spent hours shredding hundreds of old documents. No problem with staples. No problems with jams. We did test it out to see if it could shred 16 pages as listed. It did with no problem. It does a great job of totally destroying the documents. No chance of anyone recovering it. Can't say much about longevity since we have had it less than a week. But we are very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: Its okay. Like the small shred cut
customer_reviews.text: Not as big nor does it shred as many papers at one time that it mentioned. I like the shredded cut, though. Its better than my old Fellowes shredder that only cut in strips. So, better in many ways. Wish it cut more paper at a time. A bit harder to get paper into the cutting area. Like the window that shows how full it is. I rarely give anything 5 stars. This would have been 4 stars had it been a bit more rugged and able to cut more papers at a time.
customer_reviews.author: KindleKen

customer_reviews.title: Works good-but with design problem
customer_reviews.text: Arrived promptly and was easy to install. The safety features are a bit much-as the shredded paper holder seems to be too sensitive, and I have to push the front center in for it to work. It almost seems as if the plastic is slightly warped and it curves out-but just enough that it only works when pressing this part. I have tried it without the included trash bag thinking it might be blocking-but still didn’t work. A bit frustrating and inconvenient to be feeding paper with one hand and pushing the trash receptacle with the other. Contacted company and never heard back.
customer_reviews.author: BetzR

customer_reviews.title: My junk mail solution
customer_reviews.text: Nice and quiet with the power to shred junk mail. I can use this shredder without setting off my dog alarm. Every time I used my old Fellowes W11C, my dog started barking. (I might add that W11C is still going strong after years of service.) This one is quiet enough to be used with minimal disruption to normal household activities like holding a conversation or watching TV. The ability to use a bag is great. The automatic stop safety feature is what sold me on this model. It stops if you come in contact with the metal feed opening.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Murry

customer_reviews.title: could use a wider mouth.
customer_reviews.text: It is doing the job. However the "mouth" is on the small side, therefore it takes more of my time to feed the shredder. On the other hand the pull -out basket works better then my previous shredder. In that case I had to remove the top , teeth mechanism, which left a bunch of shredded bits on the floor. So this basket deign does save me a little cleanup time. Heads up: the machine stops mid shred to access the thickness and then proceeds.this slows down the job.
customer_reviews.author: Msquared

customer_reviews.title: Fellowes = Worst shredder ever
customer_reviews.text: I'm so so sad that I purchased this shredder. I got it because I thought Fellowes would be a good brand. This shredder feels flimsy and has a poor User Interface. DO NOT BUY THIS SHREDDER! I'd buy a Royal Shredder next time. The Royal shredders I've had have been total workhorse shredders. Easy to use and terrific.
customer_reviews.author: LSS

customer_reviews.title: Best Shredder EVER
customer_reviews.text: I have a small tax office. I have to get rid of sensitive documents safely. I have owned a number of shredders. This is by far the best. It has every feature you could want. It has an indicator for when you are shredding too much. It tells you when the basket is full, it tells you when to oil it...it's PERFECT! Very quiet when running. it also has nice shut off safety features. If you need to move it....it's on wheels no problem. Did the research.. It got high ratings. Also checked it out on you tube. You can not go wrong with this one. Great shredder!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo

customer_reviews.title: A user-friendly shredder
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I've had it less than two weeks but I've been using it very heavily (about an hour a half a day during the week) and it's held up like a trooper. Pros: VERY quiet. Automatically senses how many sheets I'm trying to feed and it won't even start if I have too many. Therefore, no jams! Cons: Small capacity. I would have bought the next size up but it wasn't available. Just be aware that it needs emptying frequently if you're shredding a lot. Hard to close after you've opened the bin.
customer_reviews.author: Throbble Fleep

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job
customer_reviews.text: My retired Mom responds to the political surveys and such that come in the mail. Our Post Master says we get more mail than most companies in our area. Therefore our name and address is on plenty of papers needing to be shredded. Our old Fellowes 99Ci shredder had stopped working well due to an unseen steel token in the junk mail. I did some research and decided on this smaller unit to replace it. This newer Fellowes 79Ci shreds better than the old one. The smaller container is easier to lift and more manageable when emptying into bags for recycling. It is also very quiet during operation. It is a wonderful asset to our household.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reliable unit with great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this as a home shredder for over seven years and never once had any issues with it, despite hardly ever emptying it and doing zero maintenance on it during all that time. Today it stopped working, so I called the customer service line and was immediately connected with an extremely pleasant and knowledgeable lady who walked me through the problem, helped me fix it, and explained exactly what to do to prevent a reoccurrence. I am extremely impressed with both the shredder and Fellowes' customer service.
customer_reviews.author: englishmama

customer_reviews.title: Power button failure
customer_reviews.text: There are two power switches to make this unit work. The primary top power switch failed within 24 hrs of lite home use. Used troubleshooting manual and online videos to no avail. Looks like the power switch is a frequent failure issue on this model after seeing so many how-to-fix videos specifically about this switch. It was quiet and shredded fine. It is top heavy obviously so it could be a tip over risk.
customer_reviews.author: Muldor Havinski

customer_reviews.title: Bought this shredder in Jan 2010, still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I have not had any issues with this shredder in the 10yrs I've had it. Keep it oiled regularly, don't overuse it (continuous shred, but overheat function will shut down until cool off) and its handled just about anything I've shoved in it, cardboard, paper bags, bills, etc. Plenty of pictures to show whats left from other posts, but wanted to reiterate that you cant go wrong with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Geo

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: It holds very little shredded paper. You have to push it down because it stops working numerous times when the bin is being filled. Only problem here is the bottom is falling out the first day I am using it. The plastic bags do not fit at all. I found that it is easier to not use a bag at all...when bin is full I empty it into a plastic bag. Terrible waste of money. I would return it if I had the box, but my housekeeper put it in the trash. My old shredder was 200% better. Only problem is the I gave it to my housekeeper.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn B

customer_reviews.title: Great Shredder!
customer_reviews.text: I had my prior Fellows shredder for 18 years. It did not break down, but the wheels did. They have fixed the wheels on the 79Ci. It is a nicely made shredder with three features I really like. The new wheels are great, the safety features, and the way you push a little button on top to start. Thank you, Fellows. The noise level is not that high, but it is not silent. I highly recommend this shredder. It even came early.
customer_reviews.author: Computer Nut

customer_reviews.title: ... for the price it would have been made much better. It seems too fill up way to fast
customer_reviews.text: I thought for the price it would have been made much better. It seems too fill up way to fast. It does not shred 16 sheets of paper. It makes a massive mess every time you need to empty it. If you are using a plastic bag inside, it is hard to get the drawer to close. I would not buy this model again.
customer_reviews.author: john g.

customer_reviews.title: Shreds well but the bin is flimsy
customer_reviews.text: The machine is very quiet for its size and weight. While it shreds well, the crosscuts are larger than those produced by my former 10+ year old Fellowes machine. I'm concerned the quality of the bin doesn't measure up to the overall machine. The bin is the weakest component. The plastic is too flimsy considering the bin snaps/clicks into place. Be careful inserting and removing the bin. I just started using the machine in the last 2 days. I'm not a heavy user of a shredder. I'll update this review if my experience changes.
customer_reviews.author: aniah

customer_reviews.title: Endures years of heavy use in small office
customer_reviews.text: No shredder lasts forever, but this model of this brand is all I will buy for our office. Others have lasted months, but these last years. We currently have three. The one that is 5 years old is making some unusual noise, so it’s now by the desk that produces less paper to shred. It doesn’t actually do 16 sheets, but 10 or so is not a strain. I also have had one replaced under manufacturer’s warranty with no hassle.
customer_reviews.author: CDville

customer_reviews.title: Best Paper Shredder I've owned
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best paper shredder I've owned. It truly is Jam Proof and so much quieter than any others I've used. It is a full 16 sheet capacity and with the cross cut shredding my documents are completely safe from dishonest eyes. Worth evedry penny.
customer_reviews.author: FON

customer_reviews.title: happy and secure
customer_reviews.text: so far so good, unit arrived well packed and easy assembly. Someone asked about getting casters on in previous question. simply push in and tape with small hammer or wrench end on the back end of caster where the post is and it snaps in perfectly. It is a lot less noise then my previous fellowes shredder, and the thickness/ potential jam indicator is pretty nice. Capacity of shredded material is lower then my previous unit but not major thing. easy cleanup and maintenance. I do wish there were "flaps" that when you pulled out the basket the flaps would cover the shreds so they don't fly out or spill, but using plastic waste basket liners works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Steve K.

customer_reviews.title: Longest lasting shredder I have ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: I have a small office and we shred several documents every day there are about 4 to 8 pages thick. I have purchased a lot of shredders over the years, but this one has been the best. I purchased one four years ago and it is still going strong. I just purchased another of the same model to replace a shredder that is not working well and does not have the same capacity as this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kai Jai

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Dependable Workhorse
customer_reviews.text: We researched this shredder before purchasing and have been amazed at how well the Fellowes Powershred 79Ci handles all the mail and other items we put through it everyday. The absolute best feature is not having to wait while a shredder cools down when we put a large volume of paper though it as this model just keeps on going and going. It has consistently performed well for us, has large enough capacity that we aren't constantly emptying it, fits into the small space we have for storing the shredder, and the bottom line is that it works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shredder!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with my Fellowes Powershred 79Ci Jam Proof shredder. This is a big improvement over my ten year old Fellowes shredder. Some features that I like on this shredder are: A) It is much quieter than my old shredder. B) The wheels on the bottom of the unit make it handy for moving it around. C) The clear plastic flip up cover for the shredding slot is a good safety feature. D) There is an additional on/off control which is nice as a safety feature, as well. I am very impressed with the thought that went into the design of this shredder. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Efficiency Plus!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a lot of shredders, but this is by far the best I've ever used. Handles volume with the ease, whether it's several papers at once or hundreds over a full day's work. The lubricating oil is a must! Make sure to purchase it at the same time you buy this shredder. Super quiet (relatively speaking). My wife doesn't even hear it and my office is right over hers. Happyy wife, happy life! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Annisha

customer_reviews.title: Quiet beast.
customer_reviews.text: Just got this shredder last night and so far I really like it. I've only used it enough to fill up the bucket 3 times so no data on the long term. Pros: really quiet - I ran it while watching TV without having to adjust the volume it will handle 16 pages with no problem indicator light lets you know when the stack of papers is getting close to being too large for the shredder - helping avoiding a jam and/or reverse action Cons: not really issues yet - box is sort of heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for the shredding of our documents. Has not jammed and we’ve shredded several large trash bags so far. We don’t use the inside liner as it is much easier when it’s full to transfer shredded material by grabbing handfuls from the container and placing it in large trash bags. To protect the motor, it will shut itself off when it gets too hot. You’ll need to wait 5-10 minutes before you can restart the machine. Works great for us!
customer_reviews.author: BBoyd

customer_reviews.title: Nice but not Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Shredder but the pieces are much larger than my last shredder was (Different Company/Brand). It dose allow me to shred more sheets at a time. I read complaints about the basket not closing proper and I too experience that same problem. If you push the basket just under the clear window on the bottom/front it pops the basket right into place perfect. Because the shredded pieces are larger it doesn't take long to fill the basket so I have to empty it so much more than I did with my last one.
customer_reviews.author: BELLA MIA

customer_reviews.title: Occasional user; no complaints. Shreds great.
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. It shreds great. I’ve only had it a month though. The basket that holds the shredded paper is a pain to put back in again after I took it out to empty it, but other than that I’m happy. I’m not a constant shredder of large piles so I can’t compare my usage with that of someone who shreds a lot, all the time. They might have a different experience because they’re really putting it through its paces. I’m more an occasional user, and for that, I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Planet77

customer_reviews.title: Shreds BUT
customer_reviews.text: The machine does a good job of shredding paper but the hopper that accepts the paper has to be opened several times to tamp down the shredded paper ...... There's a safety device that shuts down the shredder senses the paper level is full ... which it isn't. ... One must open the hopper and push down the paper too often. (Four or five times per load)
customer_reviews.author: Code Breaker

customer_reviews.title: If eventually became "unstuck" and now works fine. I think it got stuck because of a ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this shredder in July of 2008 from Amazon after having several cheap shredders roll over and die on me. Been in continuous use in a home setting since then. We fill a 13 gallon kitchen trash bag each week with it. The only problem we have ever had was the document sensor got stuck one time causing the unit to run until we turned it off by the power button. If eventually became "unstuck" and now works fine. I think it got stuck because of a buildup of old oil in the sensor slot. Great shredder. As long as the quality is equal to what it was about 10 years ago, look no further.
customer_reviews.author: FreeStateRacer

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is suppose to
customer_reviews.text: Quiet, efficient and shreds. This is my second Fellows shredder in 15yrs and the other one is still working too. I only purchased a second one to ease in multiple people being able to shred in the office. I/we have had no issues what so ever that I've seen other people post about, so can't say if it's user error on their part or not. All I can say, it works as stated and is very quiet. Happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: deano k

customer_reviews.title: This is a basic crosscut shredder. It is serving ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a basic crosscut shredder. It is serving its purpose. However I wouldn't buy again. I bought this one for my moms house. It is very heavy to move, even on wheels. The basket is smaller than most crosscut, so must be emptied often if doing a lot of continuous shredding. That was my reason for buying. I have owned a few shredders. If only using, as a basic every now and then item, it's ok. For the heavier duty projects, move on to something else.
customer_reviews.author: Denu

customer_reviews.title: Shreds junk mail that is still in the envelope!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shredder! I hate junk mail and I had to open each piece so I could feed it thru my old shredder. This new one - Fellowes 79CI - will shred junk mail while still in the envelope! It shreds up to 16 pages at a time, has a lighted gauge on the right side that indicates how close you are getting to this 16 page limit and it runs very quiet (almost silent compared to my old shredder). I am very happy with this shredder and, if you hate junk mail like me, this shredder will take care that for you!
customer_reviews.author: cmolle97

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than a year before throwing a code that won't go away. Fellowes is replacing the unit.
customer_reviews.text: Product worked until July 2020 (it was purchased August 2019) and the "bin door open" warning light came on and stays on no matter what you do. Of course, it doesn't operate under those conditions, so the machine is now effectively useless. I called and they're mailing me a new one, so you really can't go wrong because Fellowes stands behind their product. You can 100% trust this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Chris J.

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny!
customer_reviews.text: I love this shredder! Worth every penny! I can shred everything stated in the advertising...whole junk mail envelopes, magazines with staples, several pages at once. It's great not to have to waste time shredding one page at a time like with my old shredder. Love, love, love this product!! (And no one is paying me to say any of this). Seriously buy this.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best shredder I've ever had. It's not cheap (though Amazon price is reasonable for the product) but it is really really good. Can handle 15-16 pages at a time with no problem. I shredded weeks of material (using a normal shredder) in about 6 hours. I've also used it to shred a couple of expired credit cards, it didn't even blink! If you have some serious shredding to do, spend the money and get this one, you'll be really glad you did. Ed
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for a small office
customer_reviews.text: I actually own two of these. My toddler jammed something into the first one. I was so heart-broken of losing it, that I purchased another. Shortly after receiving the second shredder, my first one magically started working again. It probably chewed up whatever was jamming it up. That says a lot for it's durability. So now I have two 79Ci's. I use it at home, but it is good enough for a small office. I would (and have) buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kenja Roberts

customer_reviews.title: I would have thought the bin would be made of a more sturdy plastic. When I empty the bin
customer_reviews.text: Since receiving the shredder, I think I have gone through 20+ bins already. It shreds very well, however, I have to manually press the button on some junk mail that's slightly over the size limit. I would have thought the bin would be made of a more sturdy plastic. When I empty the bin, I can feel the handle flexing like it's going to break off. Other than that, it's doing its job.
customer_reviews.author: Frozendan

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse 💪🏽
customer_reviews.text: Finished shredding a bin full of documents for several hours. This thing is a champ, an absolute workhorse. I played around with the number of pages and noticed two things—it can chew up a lot at once, but, the more papers you shred (+10 pages) repeatedly, the faster it will overheat. But it cools down in a reasonable period and then gets back to work. I shredded much easier and faster without heat breaks by just feeding 3-4 pages continuously. Don’t get me wrong, it will easily shred 16 pages but you will make it work harder and hotter, giving you less time than if you just ease off and shred 3-4 continuously. Anyway, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought this machine back in 2012 and still using it!!
customer_reviews.text: Decided to write some reviews of our favorite items that my family bought on Amazon and the Fellowes shredder is one of them. Bought back in 2012 for our home office and it still works great today, this machine is not as noisy as a lot of shredders out there, it seems very sturdy strong and durable!! Try not to put too much paper at once, even though it can handle it. For long turn maintenance, it is recommended to only run 80% of its capacity. Also, periodically run shredder lubrication sheets to keep the blades moving freely. Great buy, hope this helps those who are having trouble deciding which one to buy.
customer_reviews.author: R.W

customer_reviews.title: Over heats! Does not work as promised!
customer_reviews.text: It over heats consistently. After two shreds of 3-5 pages it over heats and has to wait for cool down. About 10-15 minutes before it can be used again and in some cases you have to turn it off then on to get the over heat light to turn off after 30 min of on
customer_reviews.author: staci

customer_reviews.title: THIS THING CAN SHREAD
customer_reviews.text: Had a small Fellows previous to this and had issues with the AMOUNT of stuff to shred. This thing shreds large stacks of paper in a timely manner AND has a large collection bin. I have to typically shred credit cards here and there. I had this one card which was thicker than most and had failed on the smaller Fellowes unit I had. This unit took it without issue. Great buy for the $$$.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Talarico

customer_reviews.title: Stong but small capacity. They make $100.00 models just as good
customer_reviews.text: This model is for home users, but beware that it has small capacity of the shredded material. It will fill up quickly. The bags they want you to buy with the machine only limit the capacity more. The machine is very heavy. I have a $100.00 , 10C Fellows machine that was much better. It lasted 10 years. As far as I'm concerened It was a better machine and value.
customer_reviews.author: Jay H. Katz

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad, but large size shreds
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this shredder so far, except for one thing - the size of the shredded paper pieces it outputs! They're 5/32" x 1-1/2". Which matched the description given by Amazon, so I have nobody to blame but myself for not reading more carefully. In my opinion, these are far too large to be very secure. My previous shredder made shreds about 1/4 the size of these. Very disappointing. I should have shopped around instead of deciding based upon the number of stars in the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: selective buyer

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: Shreds paper sheets nicely. Rarely shred 16 sheets at a time but does 10 very easily. Basket capability a little smaller than I thought but easy to empty and replace. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Happy

customer_reviews.title: but cost of return shipping doesn't make it easy to just send back
customer_reviews.text: I should have gone with a micro shredder: scraps too large to provide sufficient security. When you can read all identifying info on a line, account #'s, etc, defeats the purpose, but cost of return shipping doesn't make it easy to just send back.
customer_reviews.author: el mimi

customer_reviews.title: Fast, powerful, reliable - and quiet!
customer_reviews.text: Very fast, quiet and reliable. I had years’ worth of mail and private papers to shred, and this shredder let me get through it very quickly. Love that it takes staples. Easy to use, easy to clean up the shredded paper. Much less mess than my old TSC shredder. Did I mention how quiet it is? 😁
customer_reviews.author: TruthStudent

customer_reviews.title: Bad Switch
customer_reviews.text: This was a good shredder while it lasted. As is usually the case in today's world, you can use a search engine, put in the model number followed by the word "problem" and you'll quickly identify the most common weak point for a machine. In this case, I was able to isolate my problem - the little circular switch you see on the top. It's a multi-function switch that is poorly designed and goes out after moderate use. The "fix" is expensive, meaning it isn't worth the cost of repair. .
customer_reviews.author: Truth Seeker

customer_reviews.title: Works...... but has a pretty small bin capacity.
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Fellows shredder (the first one died after about 12 years). We bought this shredder thinking that it was the same size as the one that bit the dust.......... WRONG!! This shredder's bin is pretty small and you end up emptying it pretty often if you do a lot of shredding. We'll keep it though....... just have to read the fine print next time ;-)
customer_reviews.author: James T Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money
customer_reviews.text: Replaced another Fellowes shredder after 10 years with this unit. Easy to assemble out of the box. Very quite operation, separate slot for CD and credit cards. Just beware it is very heavy
customer_reviews.author: Paul Quackenbush

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse Shredder Recommended
customer_reviews.text: This Powershred 79Ci replaced a very old Fellowes low-end shredder that barely handled 6 pages at a time. This unit handles unopened junk mail envelopes with ease and it is very quiet compared to the old unit. It has some nice features such as a visual LED gauge that shows the level of force required to shred what was fed into it and if it red-lines it will stop and back up and then move forward again to clear the jam. I've had it about 4 months and so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Jomez

customer_reviews.title: This shredder replaced an older Fellowes shredder that was not ...
customer_reviews.text: This shredder replaced an older Fellowes shredder that was not up to higher volume. It has now completed the high volume job and will be only used for personal documents from now on. Long sessions seem to cause heating but it never stopped because of that. Bin must be emptied often unless opened and pushed down. The strips(short) just pile up with no distribution. This is a shortcoming of this type of shredder. Very short pieces "might" not have this problem but would be slower and more expensive. Most of my shredding does not require that level of security.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this shredder
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for several years now and it still works like a champ! If you load too much in it then it stops so you can reduce the load a little. Handles a good stack of paper, and when it's full it lets you know so you don't keep stuffing papers in it. Very quiet operation. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Shreds great & does it quietly
customer_reviews.text: The shredder does a great job at what it's designed to do, and it does it MUCH more quietly than the cheap shredder I had before. The warning lights on the top of the shredder help you utilize the machine to its full potential, and misfeeds do indeed correct themselves! I was a little reluctant to spend this much on a paper shredder I use rather sparingly, but I'm glad that I did.
customer_reviews.author: J R

customer_reviews.title: Hasn't jammed yet, kicks back  (reverses) if too much
customer_reviews.text: Between the pre-shred analysis gauge (light strip goes from green to red based on intended feed) and that "kick back" feature (reverses the feed before jamming), this thing is great! see pic: about 6 pages yields a green light (meaning, NOT A PROBLEM)
customer_reviews.author: James Sander

customer_reviews.title: Switch Failed, was always flimsy
customer_reviews.text: It was a pretty good unit until the on/off switch failed. It was always flimsy acting and I had to often engage it multiple times for it to turn on. I had trouble finding proper bags to use. Light weight clear bags often got ripped open when trying to remove. Standard weight kitchen bags were often detected as a jam and shredder would not turn on for safety reasons. At this price, it should last for many many years.
customer_reviews.author: ellen millard

customer_reviews.title: Love this paper shredder.
customer_reviews.text: My previous fellowes paper shredder bit the dust so I bought this one. The price was a lot more than I wanted to pay, but I'm glad that I splurged! It's SO quiet compared to my last one. It has features that prevent it from overheating, overfilling, and from shredding too many papers at one time. It can easily shred credit cards and it can be emptied very easily from the front instead of having to lift off the top! No more mess of little shreds of paper going everywhere! So glad I invested this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: peacock88

customer_reviews.title: Shredding and Shredding
customer_reviews.text: This shredder does all that Fellowes says that it can do. I especially like the pull-out hopper for the shredded paper. Many other shredders require that the shredder "head" be removed to empty the hopper. This is our third Fellowes shredder, and the other two are going strong, with one having been in service for 15+ years.
customer_reviews.author: Bones

customer_reviews.title: Fellowes Shredder
customer_reviews.text: This shredder works as described. I would prefer if the cross cut was a little smaller and the shredded container fills up pretty fast. You can press it down to fit more but it slows you down. In terms of run time the most I got from it was 20 minutes before it shut down to cool off. No issues with feeding paper in and no problems with the safety features. Not outstanding but a good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Quite and solid.
customer_reviews.text: This this is great. Super quiet. It shreds a lot of paper for us. We're a three man company that uses about a case of paper every 2 months so that should give you some idea about how much we shred. I honestly can't imagine that people could put these pieces back together. My favorite thing about this machine and why went with it over the amazon product is that it's quiet. We can honestly be on the phone in the same room and not have to worry about the noise of the machine. I was surprised at how heavy the machine is.
customer_reviews.author: Wes Newell

customer_reviews.title: Better than 99Ci
customer_reviews.text: After trying out various Fellowes models to replace a 6-year old Fellowes shredder, we found the 79Ci to be the perfect size for a small home office. The 99Ci is much bigger, but it handles the same amount of paper as the 79Ci. If you try to jam the 99Ci, it'll somewhat shred, but you'll get that burning smell of it working overtime. For a lesser price, a smaller form facto and the ability to shred similar amount of paper, we opted for the 79Ci. Shred away!
customer_reviews.author: Samwise

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for small business. This one actually does what it says.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for small business. We have purchased many shredders that can’t truly handle more than 2 sheets at a time & are a p.i.t.a. to dump. This one actually does what it says. It doesn’t take up a lot of space. It rolls out of the way easily. It can actually shred a good deal of paper without clogging. And pulling the drawer to empty the paper is so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: JaCELR05

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love shredding unsolicited credit cards I get in the mail
customer_reviews.text: You've heard it before - "I never write reviews, but...." This time it's true. I read about noisy, gets hot and makes you sit, the need to clean up little pieces of paper, et al. However - this thing is as quiet as I could imagine a shredder could be as it powers through piles of stuff I would have spent all day shredding with my previous device. I absolutely love shredding unsolicited credit cards I get in the mail! Buy it. You won't be sorry. No, I don't work for Fellowes.
customer_reviews.author: csusied

customer_reviews.title: Great Shredder, Great price
customer_reviews.text: Reviewed a lot of shredders and came up with this one, price and quality were both ideal. I am now able to shred a couple of papers without having to stop and start the shredder because of jamming. The wheels are a great addition to this model which makes it easy to move it around. Tells you when it needs to be emptied, unlike my previous Fellowes which would jam and I would know it was time to empty the container. The price at Amazon was the lowest. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ivanka

customer_reviews.title: Fellowes Powershred 79Ci
customer_reviews.text: This shredder does the job well for my household - be it one sheet, one card, or 12 stacked with a paper clip. It's also sturdier than our last one and easier to empty in that you pull the bin forward to remove it instead of having to take the top off. Regarding the safety features, I haven't tested the effectiveness of it so I can't say anything about that.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Great shredder  ...... Even without the wheels
customer_reviews.text: The shredder works great and preforms as advertised. However, the reviews that talk about wheels that are either difficult or impossible to install are correct. I could not get them installed on this unit either and I tried really, really hard. Since the unit operates fine without them and won't be moved from the spot it occupies anyway this isn't a problem for me. Lost a star for the wheel problem.
customer_reviews.author: Lizard

customer_reviews.title: Great shredder but be careful that it's very very heavy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this shredder, works great after setup but the downsides are: 1. It's very very heavy! Don't life it up yourself if you are not used to lifting heavy weights! 2. Couldn't figure out how to put the wheels on, they seem to come off and don't really click in or anything. I ended up not using them. Other than that it seems ok. Fills up pretty fast so need to change the bags often to avoid a paper jam. I have only used it for a day so that's just my initial experience.
customer_reviews.author: Gg

customer_reviews.title: Had it for several months and has chewed through some ...
customer_reviews.text: Had it for several months and has chewed through some fairly large piles of papers.It will shut itself off when it gets too hot, unlike the cheaper brand that this replaced after it simply died after only a couple of months. The other features such as self monitoring volume of paper and shutting off when your hand or other object is too close. The one negative is that it's messy when emptied and shredded paper finds itself behind the basket that has to be removed before the bin is put back in.
customer_reviews.author: elf

customer_reviews.title: Setup tips
customer_reviews.text: Two defects upon unpacking: If you find that the casters won't pop in as pictured in the instruction sheet, apply oil (a small bottle comes with the machine) on the metal bit and push again. This time they should pop in easily. You'd think they'd advise you. The machine comes with its own plastic liners (just a few as a sample). There is no reliable way to fit them in the waste bin or hook them to secure them in the bin. So the paper bits still fly everywhere. Machine is otherwise quiet but waste bin surprisingly small and fills up quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Gromer

customer_reviews.title: A user friendly shredder
customer_reviews.text: This product is very good and easy to use! It is fairly quiet, takes many sheets at a time to shred, rolls around easily, holds a lot of particless before the bag needs dumping, runs a long time before the cool down period starts, and you can see the level of particles without removing the pull-out basket. This is a great product and a far cry from our old shredder...!!!
customer_reviews.author: William Steila

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse monster shredder!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best by far. It is a workhorse! I had like 3 years of paperwork I had to shred and I didn't know that it was going to cost me over 25.00 to get it shredded somewhere! I researched and spent the extra money for this model and it was well worth it! I am so happy with it and shred everything as I go now instead of letting it build up. Still have lots of files to go through but I am not dreading it.
customer_reviews.author: pscas3

customer_reviews.title: Great shredder, worth the money
customer_reviews.text: So far this has been a great shredder! It shreds easily without jamming and is quiet. I love the pullout drawer and inserted the plastic bag that came with the shredder, pushed down shredded paper in bin four times before emptying it into another bag, thus saving original plastic bag. I am so happy I spent the extra money & bought a bigger & more efficient machine!
customer_reviews.author: snowflake

customer_reviews.title: ...one of the best shredders we've ever purchased for home use
customer_reviews.text: This shredder is an upgrade for us, and it doesn't disappoint. We love how the bin pulls out from the front, so with this shredder we don't have to take the top off in order to empty the bin. We also like that it's on wheels, and that it is guaranteed not to jam (it hasn't so far). One of the best features is the thermostat icon that turns on when the unit needs to cool after 20 minutes of continuous use. It's heavy and sturdy...and it's one of the best shredders we've ever purchased for home use.
customer_reviews.author: Tabber

customer_reviews.title: It works quietly and effectively
customer_reviews.text: This is jam proof, takes paper with staples still in them and takes several sheets at once. It is heavy but quiet. I use it to safely shred personal papers. Shredded paper is fine cut so would be impossible to put back together.
customer_reviews.author: painterbj

customer_reviews.title: Shredder
customer_reviews.text: The shredder works well and doesn't jam. The shredded paper bin could be larger as it fills up quickly. Also, the bin sometimes does not go back under the shredder easily and requires a light bang against the basket.
customer_reviews.author: BG

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing and Expensive for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I am quite disappointed with the Fellowes shredder considering all the hypes about how great Fellowes shredders are from all the commercials and advertisings. My dinky little $20 shredder I purchased from Big Lot shredded documents 3 times smaller than this Fellowes shredder. Considering the price I paid for this Fellowes, I was thoroughly disappointed in comparison to my $20 Big Lot shredder , which lasted over 10 years. If you buy this Fellowes shredder , you are simply paying for the bells and whistles, not for the level of security expected. Again, my $20 Big Lot shredder was more effective and shredded documents 3 times smaller than the Fellowes shredder . Disappointing and expensive!
customer_reviews.author: Billpay288

customer_reviews.title: Great shredder
customer_reviews.text: Was surprised at how heavy this is. Great shredder though. I don't even have to turn it on (unless it's been off for several days) - as soon as it senses 2 or more sheets of paper, it automatically starts shredding. I do wish it had a handle/grab-slot on the bottom of the collection bin to make it easier to grab / hold as I'm dumping the bin into a large trash bag each week (awkward to hold the bag open while also trying to hold the top and bottom of the collection bin). Otherwise, I'm completely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Steve is unemployed

customer_reviews.title: Great producet
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I've had it for a year. I like the big capacity for holding shredded paper and it does take quite a bit. You do not have to take out the staples, yay! And you can put through credit cards. Hoping it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: saundra hadley

customer_reviews.title: We are very pleased with this machine and for using Amazon Prime
customer_reviews.text: We finally bit the bullet and bought a work horse of a shredder. The cheaper models we've had prior have all died way before their time. This machine does exactly what the promotions claim it should. 2 sheets or 16 sheets it makes no difference. We are no longer frustrated when it's time to shred. I've heard that Fellows made some very reliable shredders and this model proves to be true. We are very pleased with this machine and for using Amazon Prime. We needed a shedder Quine and on the second day after we ordered it was sitting on our porch at 10:00 A.M., and the freight charges were Zero. Thank you Fellows and Amazon Prime. RS/Bellevue WA
customer_reviews.author: Tman

customer_reviews.title: Great work horse...doesn't jam!
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of shredding, and this is the best I've ever owned. I have never had a paper jam!!! I bought it a couple of years ago thinkkng it was a bit more than I wanted to spend, but sooo worth it. If the shredder gets hung up for some reason, just hit the reverse for a second and then forward, and it up and running again. Very good capacity feeder and container. Once again, you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Armont

customer_reviews.title: good shredder
customer_reviews.text: I have put this thing through the tests. I love it. I have shredded credit cards, booklet of paper with staples, cds, and all kinds of paper. It never bogged down or clogged, and it shredded the every loving crap out of it. The only thing that kinda irks me, depending on the day, is that if you use a trash bag you have to make sure the bin closes good or it wont work. I have also manhandled it, and it still works good. I also love its on wheels so I can move it around freely. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: blueshockeygrl14

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Shredder
customer_reviews.text: I was in need of a new home-office shredder because for occasional higher volume record purging my micro-cut overheated quickly. Fellowes’ current tv ad was convincing so I asked friends and heard back that they would “only buy Fellowes” so I did. It is very well constructed with a deep opening that is very easy to target with a loose handful of sheets. Not one hint of slowing down with my usual batch of 6-10 sheets at a time and after a month of moderate use it hasn’t jammed once. Great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Fox

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a 12 year old micro-cut shredder from Fellowes and so far this does not disappoint. I'm shredding a good amount of material daily and this just hasn't slowed down at all. The only difference between the 2 units is that this one is a bit louder, but still tolerable. Overall, a good choice for those that shred frequently.
customer_reviews.author: BluDemon

customer_reviews.title: Good product, insufficient packaging.
customer_reviews.text: Came with broken basket. Fellowes took care of it, sending replacement. Whoever Amazon used for delivery dropped the box from a good height. Yes, it is well built and works well. It's a tank. Its heavier than some kids.
customer_reviews.author: R&D

product_meta.title: Fellowes Powershred 79Ci 100% Jam Proof Medium, Duty Cross, Cut Shredder, 16 Sheet Capacity, Black/Dark Silver
product_meta.description: Style:79Ci| Pattern Name:ShredderThe Fellowes Powershred 79Ci Cross-Cut Shredder can shred up to 16 sheets of paper per pass into 397 (5/32” x 1-1/2” Security Level P-4) cross-cut particles. This machine also safely shreds CDs/DVDs, credit cards, staples, paper clips and junk mail. Achieve hassle-free shredding with all of the features the 79Ci has to offer. Get three levels of advanced jam prevention with Fellowes 100% Jam Proof System which eliminates paper jams, powers through tough jobs and maximizes productivity. To protect more than your identity, the patented SafeSense Technology is designed with an electronic safety sensor that surrounds the paper entry and automatically disables the shredder when hands touch the paper opening. Also, the 79Ci’s SilentShred Technology and Energy Savings System allow this machine to integrate easily to any environment. With the ability to shred for up to 20 minutes before a cool down period is needed, the 79Ci is ideal for deskside use and includes a 6-gallon pull-out bin. Backed by a worry-free 2-year product and service warranty plus lifetime cutter warranty. 21.31" H x 15.38" W x 10.44" D. 23L pull-out bin ensures easy waste disposal
feature_bullets: 100% jam proof system eliminates paper jams and powers through tough jobs.
SilentShred offers ultra-quiet shredder performance for shared workspaces.
Energy savings system provides optimal energy efficiency 100% of the time-in use and out of use.
SafeSense technology stops shredder when hands touch the paper opening. Average Shred Speed (mpm) : 4.3. Auto Reverse : Reverse Function
Shreds 16 sheets per pass into 5/32" x 1-1/2" cross-cut particles (security level P-4).Item dimension H x W x D (inches):21.31 x 15.38 x 10.44

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars3,643 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
